Getting Started

What is Bitcoin?

Bitcoin (BTC) is the first known and decentralized cryptocurrency created by an unrevealed person or group called Satoshi Nakamoto in 2009.

The concept of Bitcoin lies in the opportunity for peer–to–peer transactions of digital money with no need for any middle party like banks. These transactions are processed by network nodes and recorded in blockchain – digital and public ledger.

Bitcoins are unable to be printed as FIAT money; they are mined and do not have a physical form. Mining is a process of adding transaction records to the blockchain; or, in simple terms, working–out computationally–difficult problems by сomputer software.

Bitcoin mining is limited; in fact, only 21 million Bitcoins exist. These 21 million can be used for different purposes; the main one stays the same – purchasing things online without any governmental or economical monitoring (Figure 1-1).

Figure 1-1: Bitcoins in circulation

Source: https://blockchain.info/ru/charts/total–bitcoins?timespan=1year

Other advantages of Bitcoin are:

  • payment freedom: buy/sell BTC, send, receive or withdraw anywhere at any time;
  • fee–selection: low fees and a possibility to choose Bitcoin exchange, wallet and fee rates on spending;
  • no–risk for merchants: no personal information needed to use Bitcoins;
  • no–inflation: Bitcoin cannot be subjected to inflation.

“Instant transactions, no waiting for checks to clear, no chargebacks (merchants will like this), no account freezes (look out Paypal), no international wire transfer fee, no fees of any kind, no minimum balance, no maximum balance, worldwide access, always open, no waiting for business hours to make transactions, no waiting for an account to be approved before transacting, open an account in a few seconds, as easy as email, no bank account needed, extremely poor people can use it, extremely wealthy people can use it, no printing press, no hyper–inflation, no debt limit votes, no bank bailouts, completely voluntary. This sounds like the best payment system in the world!”

– Trace Mayer J.D., a Leading Monetary Expert on Bitcoin and Gold

Bitcoin is not subjected to inflation and is not controlled or operated by banks. However, the price for BTC depends on the human factors of public supply and demand. Multiplication of cryptocurrency price and circulation supply shows the size of currency (market capitalization). Market Cap is the main metric to compare BTC prices.

Market Cap in 2017 shows dramatic growth of BTC (Figure 1-2).

Figure 1-2: Bitcoin Charts

Source: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/#charts

Bitcoin gained popularity after the revolution it had caused in the financial world by cryptocurrency market creation. Bitcoin consumers rely on BTC because of its decentralized nature, easy setup, anonymity, transparency, miniscule fees, and fast transactions. BTC wallets are not controlled by the government, so that BTC can be withdrawn and spent with freedom.

How to start?

TRASTRA gives you financial freedom as you can access your online account anywhere and anytime. It is absolutely convenient, fast and safe! In the TRASTRA App you can easily store, buy, sell or convert BTC/ETH into traditional money and withdraw via wire transfer.

Here is a guide on how to start your personal online banking with TRASTRA:

  1. Sign up and create an account to get your FREE Bitcoin wallet and Ethereum wallet and the best features of our services. If you need any step-by-step instructions, please click here.
  2. Add Bitcoin and Ethereum to your account. Find out more about how to top up your Bitcoin and Ethereum wallets >here.
  3. Verify your account. Proceed with ID verification to unlock all TRASTRA features and receive your personal Payment account with IBAN. Verify your account now.
  4. Deposit EUR to your Payment account with IBAN using SEPA transfers. Read more.
  5. Withdraw your funds from your account via wire transfer anywhere and anytime you want, and make EUR transfers via SEPA (cross-border Euro bank transfers). View details.
  6. Make Bitcoin and Ethereum transfers to other wallets (to your friends, colleagues, employees, etc.) and receive incoming ones with our secure wallets. Find out more about cryptocurrency transfers here.
  7. Make easy exchanges from crypto to FIAT and vice versa in the TRASTRA Web App. Please click here to get more information.
  8. Stay in touch. Read our blog and find us on social networks.
  9. Do you have any additional questions about TRASTRA and our services? We value the relationship with our customers. That’s why ongoing support is our priority. Do not hesitate to contact us anytime you need (email: support@trastra.com or via live chat). We're happy to help!

TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN

What is a SEPA transfer?

SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) is the area where citizens and companies can make and receive payments in euros. SEPA is made up of the Eurozone countries and a few other countries which also support Euro bank transfers. You can find the full list of 34 countries

Within SEPA lies the SEPA scheme, which is a set of rules that are followed by the participants in moving funds electronically from account A to account B.

SEPA payments highlights

  • Cross-functionality.
    With SEPA there is no difference between national and cross-border payments. The new harmonized SEPA payment scheme allows customers to exchange payments between any accounts located within the EEA: securely, efficiently, and more cost-effectively.
  • Streamlining payments in Europe.
    Usually, it takes 1-4 business days to credit funds to the beneficiary's bank. It depends heavily on the time of day you start your transfer as there is a 3 PM cut off time for same-day processing. Requests received after this time will be processed on the following banking day.

Bitcoin gained popularity after the revolution it had caused in the financial world by cryptocurrency market creation. Bitcoin consumers rely on BTC because of its decentralized nature, easy setup, anonymity, transparency, miniscule fees, and fast transactions. BTC wallets are not controlled by the government, so that BTC can be withdrawn and spent with freedom.

What is TRASTRA Payment account with IBAN?

Currently Unavailable. Coming soon...

IBAN stands for International Bank Account Number, which consists of a maximum of 34 alphanumeric characters: the ISO country code + 2 digits of a control key + up to 30 characters for the bank account number (e.g. for Germany: DE44 5111 0517 5707 8449 37). An IBAN is different from a SWIFT code (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication) as it identifies an dividual account involved in the cross-border payment. A SWIFT code helps overseas banks to identify which specific bank to send money to.

The main advantage of IBAN is fast processing of electronic transactions with minimum delays and extra costs which reduces the risk of propagating transcription errors.

Currently, about 54 countries of the European Union are using IBAN plus Norway, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Hungary, and others.

Verify your TRASTRA account to get a Payment Account with IBAN and the opportunity to take advantage of simple SEPA/wire payments across the whole of Europe! Buy and sell cryptocurrency using bank transfers on market rates! (Figure 1-1).

Figure 1-1: TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN

Information on how to create TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN can be found here.

Major benefits of using TRASTRA Payment Account account are:

  • Fixed fees for receiving and sending SEPA payments from 34 European countries (regardless of the amount). The full list of the SEPA zone countries can be foundhere.
  • Send money overseas to over 140 countries around the world with a speedy and reliable wire transfer.
  • Superior security and acceleration of the transfer of funds with automated payment processing. If for some reason the funds do not reach the recipient, they will be returned to the sender's account right away.
  • Making transfers within Europe, your name as the Sender/Receiver will be on the beneficiary’s bank statement.
  • Skrill, eBay, PayPal and many other similar services accept SEPA/wire transfers. So you can transfer money to and from PayPal.


Verify your account now

What is a SEPA transfer?

SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) is the area where citizens and companies can make and receive payments in euros. SEPA is made up of the Eurozone countries and a few other countries which also support Euro bank transfers. You can find the full list of 34 countries

Within SEPA lies the SEPA scheme, which is a set of rules that are followed by the participants in moving funds electronically from account A to account B.

SEPA payments highlights

  • Cross-functionality.
    With SEPA there is no difference between national and cross-border payments. The new harmonized SEPA payment scheme allows customers to exchange payments between any accounts located within the EEA: securely, efficiently, and more cost-effectively.
  • Streamlining payments in Europe.
    Usually, it takes 1-4 business days to credit funds to the beneficiary's bank. It depends heavily on the time of day you start your transfer as there is a 3 PM cut off time for same-day processing. Requests received after this time will be processed on the following banking day.

Bitcoin consumers rely on BTC because of its decentralized nature, easy setup, anonymity, transparency, miniscule fees, and fast transactions. Currently Unavailable. Coming soon...

IBAN stands for International Bank Account Number, which consists of a maximum of 34 alphanumeric characters: the ISO country code + 2 digits of a control key + up to 30 characters for the bank account number (e.g. for Germany: DE44 5111 0517 5707 8449 37). An IBAN is different from a SWIFT code (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication) as it identifies an dividual account involved in the cross-border payment. A SWIFT code helps overseas banks to identify which specific bank to send money to.

The main advantage of IBAN is fast processing of electronic transactions with minimum delays and extra costs which reduces the risk of propagating transcription errors.

Currently, about 54 countries of the European Union are using IBAN plus Norway, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Hungary, and others.

  • Superior security and acceleration of the transfer of funds with automated payment processing. If for some reason the funds do not reach the recipient, they will be returned to the sender's account right away.
  • Making transfers within Europe, your name as the Sender/Receiver will be on the beneficiary’s bank statement.

IBAN stands for International Bank Account Number, which consists of a maximum of 34 alphanumeric characters: the ISO country code + 2 digits of a control key + up to 30 characters for the bank account number (e.g. for Germany: DE44 5111 0517 5707 8449 37). An IBAN is different from a SWIFT code (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication) as it identifies an dividual account involved in the cross-border payment. A SWIFT code helps overseas banks to identify which specific bank to send money to.

The main advantage of IBAN is fast processing of electronic transactions with minimum delays and extra costs which reduces the risk of propagating transcription errors.

Currently, about 54 countries of the European Union are using IBAN plus Norway, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Hungary, and others.

Verify your TRASTRA account to get a Payment Account with IBAN and the opportunity to take advantage of simple SEPA/wire payments across the whole of Europe! Buy and sell cryptocurrency using bank transfers on market rates! (Figure 1-1).

Figure 1-1: TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN

Information on how to create TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN can be found here.

Major benefits of using TRASTRA Payment Account account are:

  • Fixed fees for receiving and sending SEPA payments from 34 European countries (regardless of the amount). The full list of the SEPA zone countries can be foundhere.
  • Send money overseas to over 140 countries around the world with a speedy and reliable wire transfer.
  • Superior security and acceleration of the transfer of funds with automated payment processing. If for some reason the funds do not reach the recipient, they will be returned to the sender's account right away.
  • Making transfers within Europe, your name as the Sender/Receiver will be on the beneficiary’s bank statement.
  • Skrill, eBay, PayPal and many other similar services accept SEPA/wire transfers. So you can transfer money to and from PayPal.

TRASTRA Payment Account with IBAN

What is a SEPA transfer?

SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) is the area where citizens and companies can make and receive payments in euros. SEPA is made up of the Eurozone countries and a few other countries which also support Euro bank transfers. You can find the full list of 34 countries

Within SEPA lies the SEPA scheme, which is a set of rules that are followed by the participants in moving funds electronically from account A to account B.

SEPA payments highlights

  • Cross-functionality.
    With SEPA there is no difference between national and cross-border payments. The new harmonized SEPA payment scheme allows customers to exchange payments between any accounts located within the EEA: securely, efficiently, and more cost-effectively.
  • Streamlining payments in Europe.
    Usually, it takes 1-4 business days to credit funds to the beneficiary's bank. It depends heavily on the time of day you start your transfer as there is a 3 PM cut off time for same-day processing. Requests received after this time will be processed on the following banking day.

Bitcoin gained popularity after the revolution it had caused in the financial world by cryptocurrency market creation. Bitcoin consumers rely on BTC because of its decentralized nature, easy setup, anonymity, transparency, miniscule fees, and fast transactions. BTC wallets are not controlled by the government, so that BTC can be withdrawn and spent with freedom.
